summary: The United States has increasingly used sanctions—such as freezing assets under U.S. control—to counteract threats to U.S. interests. We reviewed federal agencies’ roles in, and the resources they devote to, carrying out sanctions. Key agencies have generally received steady or growing funding. However, Treasury and State Department sanctions units have had difficulty filling positions. Treasury attributes its hiring challenges to competition and the time required...
title: Economic Sanctions: Treasury and State Have Received Increased Resources for Sanctions Implementation but Face Hiring Challenges
